NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS
119 GREGORY HALL
URBANA, ILLINOIS
January 7, 1954
Mr. C. G. Vfoodhouse, Instructor
Klamath Union High School
Klamath Falls, Oregon
Dear Mr. Woodhousei
I am very happy to Inform you officially that the Board of Directors of NAEB
has approved your application for associate membership in our organization.
You will now be receiving regularly from the the monthly NAEB Newsletter.
additional publications of interest, and many other things. You should, of
course, feel free to write to this office at any time for any information
concerning educational broadcasting.
Under separate cover we are sending you a copy of the NAEB Badio-feleyi sion
Bibliography, which we hopÂ© you will find helpful.
Perhaps the greatest good of an NAEB membership is the associations you form.
It *s good to know that others are having the same problems you are and how
they are solving them. It has been the tradition with NAEB to exchange this
sort of information on a friend-to-friend basis. You*H find lots of friends
in NAEB*
Sincerely,
HJStrtb
e.o.s Mr. Ausmus
Mr. Dunn
Jfc*. Miller
